alma.scheduling.planning_mode_sim.define
Class TimeInterval

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--alma.scheduling.planning_mode_sim.define.TimeInterval
public class TimeInterval
extends java.lang.Object

The TimeInterval is a utility class used to define an interval of time between two STime objects.

Version:
1.00 Jun 3, 2003
Author:
Allen Farris

Constructor Summary
TimeInterval(DateTime start, DateTime end)
          Define an interval of time given the starting and ending time.
TimeInterval(DateTime time, int seconds)
          Define an interval of time given a starting time and a duration in seconds.
TimeInterval(int seconds)
          Define a duration of time in units of seconds.
TimeInterval(TimeInterval interval)
          Create a new Interval that is a copy of the specofied interval.

public TimeInterval(int seconds)
Define a duration of time in units of seconds. In this case the starting time is 0.
